Posts.Content: Feb 5, 2009 03:19PM pottergal wrote: i had my sim last week and xrays and nude photos yesterday. today was the real thing.  also had the bolus on my chest.  wow, it was cold.  after being in the room several times previously for sim and xrays i found that my right hand and fingers went numb. so today i brought a washcloth to lay on the hand stirrup and it went much better.  i was suprised how little time the entire procedure took. i had a 10am appt and was out and dressed by 10:30.  so far, so good. but my rad onc said i was to expect some skin burning as she had to radiate the skin area more than she really wanted.  i will be finished march 17 and cant wait till it is all over.  the question of doing rads was left up to me.  i am 72 and we weren't sure of the benefit.  but i felt i had done the chemo so i might a well go the entire way and hope to reassure myself of a very little chance of reoccurrence.  i am i good shape and feel that i can take all this stuff while later in life if i need to i might not be so healthy.  it is like a crap shoot and i decided to give myself the best of odds. one rad down and 27 to go-- so here goes the glowing pottergal

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2009 04:27PM pottergal wrote: i had a mast-my right breast is all gone. i just finished #2 rad and they used a bolus. the techs said this is so they can radiate the surface without going into the chest wall. the cold bolus is suposed to "trick" the rad machine so it doesn't go too deep.  i have 26 more to go and fortunately i live only 2 miles from the cancer center.  so when it is snowing or icing over i still can get there.  as for walking exercise, just forget it. i don't want to slip, fall and break any of my bones.  walking will have to wait. so as of now the first two were not bad and i hope it will continue tol go as easily as those unique-is the wii fit interesting to work out on.  as of now i am doing pilates 2x a week, but have wondered about wii fit.  would love to hear some more about it loving the two day weekend respite from the hospital.........

Posts.Content: Feb 24, 2009 11:16AM pottergal wrote: today i am totally wiped out. i only have 15 more to go out of 28. my skin is starting to redden but today's tiredness is total.  i was tired with fec chemo, but this is too much. my husband is jealous that i can sleep so much-did 8 1/2 hours last night whilst he only slept 6 1/2.  i told him i would  exchange  short sleep if he would take the rads-  has anyone else crashed like this.  and to top it off we are having friends over for dinner and movie.  maybe i'll just say hello and tuck myself back into bed-sounds good at this point.  anyway i am off to another nap now...

Posts.Content: Mar 10, 2009 04:55PM - edited Mar 10, 2009 04:57PM by pottergal only  FIVE more to go!!!!!!!!!! but now i have pimples and reddening on my back. onc says it is bcause the rads are being beamed to my clavicle area are going thru to the back---i didn' t know or expect that. so i have to keep cream on that area plus my mast site.  also i now have pain-sharp stabbing sensations most of the  time.  i  can't wait till it is all over and done.   thanks for the idea of the extra soft hanes t-shirts. with all this goo on my body i need to protect my outer clothing. and now a piece of help from me. i was speaking to a fellow rad patient who used to wear wired bras. she has begun wearing them again because she has removed the wire on the mast side ad the wire helps the uplift (for large boobs)  on the unaffected side.  now i am going to try that to see if i can rehab some of my good and favorite bras. good luck to all of us coming to the end of the nuking.
